examples: As the saying goes, kindle not a fire you cannot put out.

words.defineEn: cause to start burning

examples: Kindred tells the story of an African American woman named Dana Franklin, who, for reasons we never really find out, is pulled back in time to a pre-Civil War Maryland plantation.

words.defineEn: similar in quality or character
words.defineVi: tương tự về chất lượng hoặc tính cách

examples: He was notorious for his religious zeal and his fervent defense of the church during a time when Christians were heavily persecuted for their beliefs.

examples: One particularly violent incident involved the murder of an entire family by an anti-slavery zealot from New York named John Brown.

words.defineEn: showing impressive commitment and enthusiasm for something
words.defineVi: thể hiện cam kết ấn tượng và sự nhiệt tình cho một cái gì đó

examples: The bureau bungled it.

examples: They rented the same bungalow year in, year out.

examples: But real alchemists weren’t just mystical misers.
words.defineEn: a stingy hoarder of money and possessions (often living miserably)
words.defineVi: một người tích trữ tiền bạc và của cải keo kiệt (thường sống khổ sở)

examples: And number seven is: adopts a miserly spending style towards self and others.

examples: She was always into sports and social activities, while I was your typical bookworm with very few friends.

examples: These include depressive disorders, typified by prolonged hopelessness and lethargy, and bipolar disorders, the most prominent of which involve alternating between depression and mania.

examples: To the public, he’s a refreshing contradiction to stereotypes about physicists: A safe-cracking, bongo-playing, mildly-philanderous non-conformist whose heavily brooklyn-accented voice you’ve probably heard either relaying some bit of no-nonsense pragmatic wisdom about the only sensible way to view the world, or else some wry joke told through a crooked smile.
words.defineEn: twisted or distorted, often indicating dry or mocking humor.

examples: To lead a life of luxury/a miserable existence.

words.defineVi: thực tế hoặc trạng thái tồn tại hoặc là thực khách quan

examples: The threat to the NFL from this litigation was existential.
